items.name: The Forgotten
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Unlock **The Forgotten**.

## Requirements
- Access to Boss Rush (needs Mom killed fast enough).
- Survive while being chased by stomps after starting the quest.

## Step-by-step from a fresh run
- On Floor 1, beat the boss in under 1 minute.
- Return to the starting room and bomb the centre to reveal the shovel piece.
- Pick up the quest item (you’ll be chased by stomps).
- Reach and complete Boss Rush while carrying it.
- Finish the sequence in the Dark Room to unlock **The Forgotten**.

## Tips
- Bring mobility and defensive items. The stomps do not negotiate.

items.name: The Lost
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Unlock **The Lost**.

## Requirement
- You need **Missing Poster**.

## Step-by-step from a fresh run
- Get **Missing Poster**.
- Find a Sacrifice Room.
- Die on the spikes while holding Missing Poster.
- You unlock **The Lost**.

items.name: Mega Satan
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Beat **Mega Satan** (door in **The Chest** or **The Dark Room**).

## Requirements
- You need **Key Piece 1** and **Key Piece 2**.
- You get them by defeating **Uriel** and **Gabriel** in **Angel Rooms**.

## Step-by-step (fresh run)
### 1) Get onto the Angel route
- Play normally and aim for Angel Rooms (see [[Angel vs Devil Deals]]).
- You can still go to Chest/Dark Room later.

### 2) Get the Key Pieces
- When you enter Angel Rooms, you may fight:
  - **Uriel** (drops Key Piece 1)
  - **Gabriel** (drops Key Piece 2)
- Collect both.

### 3) Reach Chest or Dark Room
- Beat [[Isaac (Boss)]] to reach **The Chest** or beat [[The Lamb]] route into **The Dark Room** (details depend on your unlocks).
- In those floors, find the huge golden door with a keyhole.

### 4) Open and fight
- Use the two Key Pieces to open the door.
- Fight Mega Satan.

## Notes
- If you never see Angel Rooms: you’re probably taking Devil Deals too often. See [[Angel vs Devil Deals]].

items.name: Ultra Greed
items.instructions: From a fresh run: play Greed Mode and reach the final floor to fight Ultra Greed.

items.name: Ultra Greedier
items.instructions: From a fresh run: unlock Greedier, then finish Greedier Mode to fight Ultra Greedier.

items.name: Hush
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Beat **Hush** at the end of **Blue Womb**.

## Requirements (what the game wants from you)
- Reach **Mom’s Heart / It Lives!** fast enough to open the **Blue Womb** entrance.

## Step-by-step (fresh run)
- Play a normal run down to **Womb II**.
- Beat **Mom’s Heart** (or **It Lives!** if you’ve progressed far enough for it to replace Mom’s Heart).
- If you met the time requirement, a big blue trapdoor/portal opens to **Blue Womb**.
- Go down.
- Clear Blue Womb and fight **Hush** at the end.

## What if you miss the time?
- No Blue Womb for that run.
- Build speed:
  - Stop full-clearing every floor.
  - Don’t spend 40 years deciding in shops.
  - Take free teleports and skip dead ends.

## Why you care (beyond checklist)
- Hush is one of the main gateways to [[Delirium]] (Void portal chances).

items.name: Delirium
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Beat **Delirium** in **The Void**.

## What The Void is
- A special endgame floor that can appear via a **portal** after certain big fights.
- Delirium is the final boss of that area.

## How to reach The Void (fresh run options)
### Most common: after [[Hush]]
- Beat [[Hush]] in Blue Womb.
- After the fight, a portal may open to **The Void**.
- Enter it to reach Delirium.

### Other portals (also valid)
- A portal can also appear after other late bosses (examples: [[Mega Satan]], end-of-run floors like Chest/Dark Room, etc.).
- It’s not guaranteed. RNG loves being a jerk.

## Step-by-step if you get the portal
- Take the portal to **The Void**.
- Clear floors until you find the Delirium boss room.
- Beat **Delirium**.

## New-player advice
- If you want Delirium consistently, aim to reach [[Hush]] first because it’s the most repeatable route.

items.name: Mother
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Beat **Mother** at the end of [[Corpse]].

## This is the “big picture”
- You are taking the Repentance **Alt Path**.
- You will collect **two Knife Pieces**.
- You will use the completed Knife to open special doors that lead deeper into the route.

## Requirements checklist
- Access alt floors: [[Downpour/Dross]] → [[Mines/Ashpit]] → [[Mausoleum/Gehenna]] → [[Corpse]]
- Collect:
  - [[Knife Piece 1]]
  - [[Knife Piece 2]]
- Survive long enough to actually arrive at Corpse (the hardest requirement, emotionally).

## Full step-by-step (fresh run)
### 1) Get onto the alt path
- Clear Chapter 1.
- After the boss, take the door to [[Downpour/Dross]] (if you don’t see it, check [[Unlocking the Alt Path Floors]]).

### 2) Build the Knife
- On [[Downpour/Dross]], complete [[Knife Piece 1]].
- Continue to [[Mines/Ashpit]] and complete [[Knife Piece 2]].
- The Knife completes automatically.

### 3) Use the Knife doors
- Use the Knife to enter [[Mausoleum/Gehenna]].
- Finish Mausoleum/Gehenna and use the Knife door to enter [[Corpse]].

### 4) Reach and beat Mother
- Progress through Corpse and defeat **Mother**.

## Common gotchas
- The Knife doors cost health. Plan for it (extra hearts, soul hearts, defensive items).
- The route is longer and harder. Speed is less important than survival.
- If you get confused mid-run, use the dropdown to jump to the relevant step: [[Downpour/Dross]], [[Knife Piece 1]], [[Knife Piece 2]], [[Mausoleum/Gehenna]], [[Corpse]].

items.name: Dogma
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Beat **Dogma** on the Beast route.

## Requirements
- Start [[Ascent & Dad's Note]].
- Reach [[Home]].

## Step-by-step from a fresh run
- Get to Depths II and defeat Mom.
- Pick up **Dad’s Note** to begin [[Ascent & Dad's Note]].
- Keep ascending until you arrive at [[Home]].
- Proceed to trigger the **Dogma** fight.

## After Dogma
- You are locked into the Beast route leading to [[The Beast]].

items.name: The Ultra Harbingers
items.instructions: From a fresh run: after Dogma, fight Ultra Famine/Pestilence/War/Death on the way to The Beast.

items.name: The Beast
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Beat **The Beast** (Repentance end route).

## Requirements
- Start [[Ascent & Dad's Note]].
- Reach [[Home]].
- Beat [[Dogma]].
- Defeat the Ultra Harbingers sequence.

## Step-by-step (fresh run, no assumptions)
### 1) Reach Depths II
- Play normally until **Depths II** (the Mom floor).

### 2) Trigger the Ascent
- Defeat **Mom**.
- A special item appears: **Dad’s Note**.
- Pick it up to start [[Ascent & Dad's Note]].

### 3) Reach Home
- Keep ascending floor-by-floor (you’re basically going backwards).
- Eventually you arrive at [[Home]].

### 4) Dogma → Beast
- Proceed in Home until you trigger and defeat [[Dogma]].
- Then you fight the Ultra Harbingers sequence.
- Finally you fight **The Beast**.

## If you’re lost mid-run
- Use the dropdown links to jump to: [[Ascent & Dad's Note]] and [[Home]].

items.name: Ultra Famine (The Beast)
items.instructions: From a fresh run: on the Beast route (post-Dogma), defeat this Ultra Harbinger during the ascent fight sequence.

items.name: Ultra Pestilence (The Beast)
items.instructions: From a fresh run: on the Beast route (post-Dogma), defeat this Ultra Harbinger during the ascent fight sequence.

items.name: Ultra War (The Beast)
items.instructions: From a fresh run: on the Beast route (post-Dogma), defeat this Ultra Harbinger during the ascent fight sequence.

items.name: Ultra Death (The Beast)
items.instructions: From a fresh run: on the Beast route (post-Dogma), defeat this Ultra Harbinger during the ascent fight sequence.

items.name: Downpour/Dross
items.instructions:
## What it is
- An alternate version of **Basement** (Chapter 1.5). In Repentance, after you beat the Chapter 1 boss you can sometimes choose an alt-floor instead of going straight to Chapter 2.

## How to enter (from a fresh run)
- Clear Chapter 1 (Basement/Cellar/Burning Basement).
- Beat the boss.
- Look for the **alternate floor door** that appears after the boss fight.
- Go through to **Downpour** (or its variant **Dross**).

## What to look for here (Mother route)
- You need this floor to get [[Knife Piece 1]].
- You are specifically hunting for:
  - A **white flame** room.
  - A **mirror** in a special room that lets you enter a “mirror world”.

## Tips so you don’t get baited
- If you never see the alt door after the boss: you didn’t meet the unlock requirements yet (see [[Unlocking the Alt Path Floors]]).
- Downpour/Dross is harder than normal Basement: more bullets, more traps, more “why do I still play this”.

items.name: Mines/Ashpit
items.instructions:
## What it is
- An alternate version of **Caves** (Chapter 2.5). The alt floor is **Mines** (variant **Ashpit**).

## How to enter
- You generally reach this after doing [[Downpour/Dross]].
- At the end of Downpour II/Dross II, take the alt-path door to **Mines/Ashpit** instead of going to Depths.

## Why you care
- This is where you get [[Knife Piece 2]] for [[Mother]].

## What you’re hunting
- A **yellow minecart track** room with a button (the “chase” trigger).
- It starts a sequence where you’re being pursued. You need to survive and reach the end to grab the piece.

items.name: Mausoleum/Gehenna
items.instructions:
## What it is
- An alternate version of **Depths** (Chapter 3.5). The alt floor is **Mausoleum** (variant **Gehenna**).

## How to enter (Mother route)
- You must have the completed Knife (assembled from [[Knife Piece 1]] + [[Knife Piece 2]]).
- At the end of Mines II/Ashpit II you’ll see a special door. Use the Knife on it to open it.
- You will take damage to pass. Plan HP accordingly.

## Why you care
- Mausoleum/Gehenna is the gateway to [[Corpse]] and the [[Mother]] fight.

## New-player warnings
- The “knife door” costs health. If you arrive with 1 heart and vibes, you’re going to have a bad time.
- Enemy density and damage ramps up hard here.

items.name: Knife Piece 1
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Obtain **Knife Piece 1** on [[Downpour/Dross]] for the [[Mother]] route.

## Requirements
- You must be on [[Downpour/Dross]].
- You need to find:
  - A **white flame** room
  - A **mirror** room

## Step-by-step (new player, no assumptions)
- Explore the floor until you find the **white flame** (it’s a bright white fire in a room).
- Walk into/touch the white flame.
  - This changes you into a special “Lost-like” form (fragile, no normal hearts).
- Now find the room with the **mirror**.
- Walk through the mirror.
  - You enter a mirrored version of the floor (layout is similar but flipped).
- In the mirror world, you must reach the special objective room and pick up **Knife Piece 1**.
- After you pick it up, you can leave (mirror back) and continue the run.

## Common gotchas
- If you touch the white flame then take a hit in the mirror-world form: you can die fast. Play it safe.
- Don’t forget: you must touch the white flame BEFORE using the mirror.
- If you can’t find the white flame or mirror on a given Downpour/Dross: RNG can troll you. Try again next run.

items.name: Knife Piece 2
items.instructions:
## Goal
- Obtain **Knife Piece 2** on [[Mines/Ashpit]] for the [[Mother]] route.

## Requirements
- You must be on [[Mines/Ashpit]].
- You need to find the **button/trigger room** (it starts a chase).

## Step-by-step
- Explore Mines/Ashpit until you find the room with the **big yellow button** (and often minecart track visuals).
- Press the button to begin the chase sequence.
- Survive the chase:
  - Keep moving.
  - Prioritize dodging over damage.
  - Use bombs/active items defensively if needed.
- Reach the end of the sequence and pick up **Knife Piece 2**.
- Once you have it, it combines automatically with [[Knife Piece 1]] to form the Knife.

## Common gotchas
- Pressing the button basically commits you. Don’t start it on 1HP unless you enjoy suffering.
- Mines/Ashpit rooms can be cramped. Clear a path, then start the chase.

items.name: Corpse
items.instructions:
## What it is
- The final set of alt floors on the [[Mother]] route (Chapter 4.5).

## How to enter
- Clear Mausoleum II/Gehenna II.
- Use the Knife door at the end to enter **Corpse**.

## What happens here
- You’ll go through Corpse floors and eventually reach the **Mother** boss fight.
- This is not “Mom”. This is Mother. She hates you personally.

items.name: Ascent & Dad's Note
items.instructions:
## What it is
- The **Ascent** is a special “reverse run” that leads to [[Home]] and eventually [[Dogma]] / [[The Beast]].

## How to start it
- Reach **Depths II**.
- Defeat Mom.
- Pick up **Dad’s Note** (this is the trigger).

## What happens next
- You start going *upward* through earlier chapters in reverse.
- Rooms are remixed and danger spikes.
- Your goal is to keep climbing until you reach [[Home]].

## Why you care
- This is the only way to get to the Beast route endgame.

items.name: Home
items.instructions:
## What it is
- A special end-game area reached via [[Ascent & Dad's Note]].

## What you do here
- Explore.
- Trigger the sequence that leads into the [[Dogma]] fight.

## Why you care
- Home is the gateway to [[Dogma]] and then [[The Beast]].

items.name: Unlocking the Alt Path Floors
items.instructions:
## What this means
- “Alt Path” floors are the Repentance alternates:
  - Basement → **Downpour/Dross**
  - Caves → **Mines/Ashpit**
  - Depths → **Mausoleum/Gehenna**
  - Then **Corpse** (via the Knife door)

## Unlock conditions (why you might not see doors)
- If you never see the alt-door after a boss, you may not have progressed far enough in the game yet.
- The exact unlock chain is tied to your overall progression (beating Mom’s Heart, unlocking later chapters, etc.).

## Practical rule for a newer player
- If you can reach Depths and Womb reliably, you’re basically “far enough” for most of this.
- If you’re brand new and only reaching Mom: focus on unlocking Womb/It Lives! first.

## What to do if it won’t show up
- Keep beating Mom’s Heart / It Lives! and pushing runs deeper.
- Once the game “opens up”, the alt doors become part of the normal toolbox.

(If you want the exact unlock gates, use the links in the dropdown item list, because patch/mod combos can tweak details.)

items.name: Angel vs Devil Deals
items.instructions:
## The basics
- After boss fights, you sometimes get a special room:
  - **Devil Room** (red)
  - **Angel Room** (white)

## Why it matters
- Some unlock routes (like [[Mega Satan]]) rely on Angel Rooms.

## How to increase Angel Room chances (simple version)
- Don’t take Devil Deals early.
- If you enter a Devil Room and *take* an item, you usually lock yourself into Devil rooms for a while.
- If you skip Devil deals (or use certain items), Angel rooms become more likely.

## How you actually get Key Pieces (for Mega Satan)
- In Angel Rooms you can fight angels:
  - **Uriel** → Key Piece 1
  - **Gabriel** → Key Piece 2
- Collect both then open the Mega Satan door in Chest/Dark Room.
